interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Passengers [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2017/03/29 Store: Jennifer Lawrence (Actor), Chris Pratt (Actor), Morten Tyldum (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure Product Description: ['Jennifer Lawrence and Chris Pratt star in a high-stakes adventure about two passengers, Jim and Aurora, onboard a spaceship transporting them to a new life on another planet. The trip takes a deadly turn when their hibernation pods mysteriously wake them 90 years before they reach their destination. As they try to unravel the mystery behind the malfunction, they begin to fall for each other only to discover that the ship itself is in grave danger. With the lives of 5000 sleeping passengers at stake, only Jim and Aurora can save them all.'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'November 12, 2019', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '043396471061', 'Director': 'Morten Tyldum', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '1 hour and 56 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 14, 2017', 'Actors': 'Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Laurence Fishburne, Andy Garcia', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Neal Moritz, Michael Maher, Ori Marmur, Stephen Hamel', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Chris Pratt turns in his usual wooden performance in a yawner of a sci fi movie. Jennifer Lawrence was fine in her role yet I found myself not caring about either character.

The plot is a bit ridiculous and the best acting in the film is turned in by Lawrence Fishburne who unfortunately suffers the fate of so many lone black actors in a film...

The plot is a bit thin and the directing not inspiring... Thank goodness this bombed at the box office so there will be no sequel. Review Title: Zzzzz.... Not the worse movie I've seen but certainly not good. Rating: 2.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Takers [Blu-ray] Paul Walker (Actor), Hayden Christensen (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ['This high-stakes action thriller stars Matt Dillon, Paul Walker, Idris Elba, Jay Hernandez, Michael Ealy and Tip “T.I.” Harris. After pulling off a spectacular series of brilliantly planned bank robberies, a notorious team of professional criminals attempts one last heist, a once-in-a-lifetime job with a $25 million payoff. And all that stands in their way is a cop hell-bent on doing whatever it takes to solve the case and bring the', 'Takers', 'down. Chris Brown and Hayden Christensen costar in an adrenaline-rushed thrill ride packed with twists and turns.'] {'Genre': 'Action, Drama', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15423113', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 18, 2011', 'Actors': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} The only true robbery is by anyone buying this movie. It had been a long time since I've seen an action movie with such a combination of bad acting, horrible directing, a snoozer for a script and a cast that couldn't deliver their lines with any sort of skills. Rappers, C-list movie stars and singers make up this woeful cast of 'professional' bank robbers who only 'take' the big ones... the major chase scenes are so ridiculous you will roll your eyes and shake your head as you watch them.... there was a host of reasons a sequel wasn't made. Ugh.... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Arkin', 'Jon Avnet', 'Peter Werner', 'Michael Dinner', 'John Dahl', 'Bill Johnson', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard'], 'Studio': ['FX Cable Channel']} After finally taking advantage of my Amazon Prime membership's video feature the first show I began watching was "Justified' after hearing people (most notable Robin Quivers) say how good it is. "The Wire" was an underrated gem! Flat out great! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Producers': ['Rudd Simmons', 'Terence Winter', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Tim Van Patten', 'Stephen Levinson', 'Mark Wahlberg'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Steve Buscemi is great in this series about Atlantic City, bootlegging and the rise of some of the most famous gangsters in American history. Hall', 'Frances Conroy'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} A great show that was ahead of its time. Great cast, writing and directing {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Alex Zakrzewski', 'Ernest R. I look forward to seeing a second season. 'Bosch' is very good with a stellar cast {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kenneth Branagh'], 'Producers': ['David Ellison', 'Dana Goldberg', 'Paul Schwake', 'Mace Neufeld', 'Lorenzo Di Bonaventura', 'David Barron', 'Mark Vahradian'], 'Starring': ['Chris Pine', 'Kevin Costner', 'Kenneth Branagh']} Hmmm... Chris Pine simply doesn't have the presence that I expect from this role and Keiera Knightly was simply annoying and distracting as his love interest.

Mr. Branaugh had directed other action films with similar underwhelming results (the first 'Thor' movie nearly put me to sleep)... This was a decently entertaining movie but not overly satisfying.

IF there is a sequel diminishing Ms. Knightly's character and more emphasis on the action involving Mr Ryan would be my advice. Not enough emphasis on the main character, too much on his wife, poorly directed {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Ohh so good! Thumbs up to season 2! Nucky gets in a major jam and his reign at the top is threatened by those who respect and revile him yet you find out why he is no one to underestimate. Season 2- the entertainment value and drama gets kicked up a few levels Archer Comedy, Animation, Action ['Archer is an animated, half-hour comedy that revolves around an international spy agency and its employees. Although their work is daunting, every covert operation and global crisis are occasions for the staff to undermine, sabotage and betray each other for personal gains, pleasures and prosperity. An FX Networks Original Series.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Fordney', 'Mack Williams', 'Matt Thompson', 'Casey Willis', 'Pierre Cerrato', 'Justin Wagner', 'Chi Duong', 'Megan Johnson', 'Chad Hurd', 'Marcus Rosentrater'], 'Producers': ['Fox']} Changing the entire premise of Archer for season 5 was IMHO an unfunny terrible ideal. I found very little to laugh at and a lot of the setups seemed lame and stretched out way too long. Why? {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Producers': ['Laura Streicher'], 'Starring': ['Larry David', 'Jeff Garlin', 'Cheryl Hines'], 'Studio': ['Discovery Global']} Larry David, the writer/performer responsible for creating 'Seinfeld' w/Jerry Seinfeld, is the world's most self-centered narcissist in the sublimely hilarious 'Curb Your Enthusiasm'. His personal relationships, marriage and interactions with people are all awkward opportunities that showcase the world isn't following his set of sometimes bizarre thoughts and rules. Consistently funny and headshaking! 'Curb Your Enthusiasm': for the self-centered narcissist in us all {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Alex Zakrzewski', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Patrick Cady', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Davidson', 'Daisy von Scherler Mayer', 'Tim Hunter', 'Christine Moore', 'Zetna Fuentes'], 'Producers': ['Eric Overmyer', 'Michael Connelly', 'Henrik Bastin', 'Pieter Jan Brugge'], 'Starring': ['タイタス・ウェリバー', 'ジェイミー・へクター', 'エイミー・アキノ']} Fast paced, action packed with good performances by all the actors...can't wait to see Season 3! Thumbs up Star Wars: The Force Awakens Harrison Ford (Actor), Mark Hamill (Actor), J.J. Abrams (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray ['Product Description', "Visionary director J.J. Abrams brings to life the motion picture event of a generation. As Kylo Ren and the sinister First Order rise from the ashes of the Empire, Luke Skywalker is missing when the galaxy needs him most. It's up to Rey, a desert scavenger, and Finn, a defecting stormtrooper, to join forces with Han Solo and Chewbacca in a desperate search for the one hope of restoring peace to the galaxy.", 'Additional Features', 'How to redeem your digital code: 1. Find Code on Insert 2. Enter Code 3. Select Provider 4. Enjoy Movie!'] {'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 4.8 Ounces', 'Director': 'J.J. Abrams', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Digital_copy, DVD+Blu-ray', 'Run time': '2 hours and 16 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 5, 2016', 'Actors': 'Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Adam Driver, Daisy Ridley', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS-HD High Res Audio)', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Studios', 'Writers': 'Screenplay by Lawrence Kasdan & J.J. Abrams and Mi', 'Number of discs': '3'} Oh my- what an expensive mess! The newcomers are mediocre to horrible actors, the plot was lifted from other Star War movies and some of the holes in the plot were bigger than the Death Star.

Death/destruction is coming yet no attempt to flee the planet?

Young Darth Vader wannabee gets into a fierce light saber fight with someone who has never used a light saber yet was holding his own? How is that possible?!

An untrained person in the Force using mind tricks that, according to previous movies, only a trained Jedi can use?

Harrison Ford looked bored and Carrie Fisher was simply 'there'... good paychecks for both I suppose (Harrison got $25 million and a cut of the box office I heard).

The Finn character is this movie's Jar Jar Binks... I was prepared to have him killed off about 20 minutes into the movie (dang- he lives on for the sequels). This young actor is awful- all wide eye looks and zero acting ability.

The Rey character is all furrowed brow and, again, ZERO acting ability. If I never see these two (John Boyega and Daisey Ridley) in another movie I will be very happy (and I won't see them together again because there is no way I'm watching the inevitable sequels of this horrid film).

The character played by Lupita Nyong'o is such a laughable rip-off of Yoda... to think she did publicity saying she was in this movie when actually it is only her voice that is in the movie. If I didn't stay for the credits I would have never known which character she played!

It looks as if JJ Abrams has bitten off too many movie projects and this was a lazy, lazy directing and script writing effort... Disney made their money and the financial backers are happy. That is the most positive thing I can say about this movie of which I wouldn't watch again if came on free TV and there was nothing else on. I was looking at my watch 30 minutes into the movie! Expensive mess... JJ Abrams took a huge misstep with this one. Passengers [Blu-ray] Jennifer Lawrence (Actor), Chris Pratt (Actor), Morten Tyldum (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure ['Jennifer Lawrence and Chris Pratt star in a high-stakes adventure about two passengers, Jim and Aurora, onboard a spaceship transporting them to a new life on another planet. The trip takes a deadly turn when their hibernation pods mysteriously wake them 90 years before they reach their destination. As they try to unravel the mystery behind the malfunction, they begin to fall for each other only to discover that the ship itself is in grave danger. With the lives of 5000 sleeping passengers at stake, only Jim and Aurora can save them all.'] {'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'November 12, 2019', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '043396471061', 'Director': 'Morten Tyldum', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '1 hour and 56 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 14, 2017', 'Actors': 'Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Laurence Fishburne, Andy Garcia', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Neal Moritz, Michael Maher, Ori Marmur, Stephen Hamel', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Chris Pratt turns in his usual wooden performance in a yawner of a sci fi movie. Jennifer Lawrence was fine in her role yet I found myself not caring about either character.

The plot is a bit ridiculous and the best acting in the film is turned in by Lawrence Fishburne who unfortunately suffers the fate of so many lone black actors in a film...

The plot is a bit thin and the directing not inspiring... Thank goodness this bombed at the box office so there will be no sequel. Zzzzz.... Not the worse movie I've seen but certainly not good.
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preferences:** The user continues to favor action and drama genres, particularly valuing character complexity, though their recent critique indicates a declining interest in films featuring star power over strong narratives. 

- **Entertainment Quality:** Historically, the user has assigned high ratings; however, their recent review reflects a significant drop, with a score of 2.0. This suggests a growing dissatisfaction with contemporary cinematic offerings that lack engaging storytelling.

- **Rating Standards:** The user's critical lens remains sharp, as demonstrated by their latest feedback focusing on thin plots and uninspiring direction. This engagement highlights their nuanced understanding of narrative expectations and character development.

- **Engagement Style:** The user remains analytical and clear in voicing their discontent, showcasing a willingness to challenge mediocrity in films they once might have rated higher. Their criticism points to a potential reluctance to accept subpar storytelling, regardless of star actor presence.

- **Interest in Star Power:** The user increasingly prioritizes compelling storytelling, emphasizing that even well-known performers cannot compensate for poor execution or a lackluster narrative. This reflects a shift towards being more selective with content, especially in well-marketed franchise films.

Overall, the user exhibits a sophisticated and discerning taste, passionately advocating for quality narratives while demonstrating an increasing intolerance for lackluster production values in their recent interactions.
